messages.author: Satish
messages.text: The 'It provides exclusive' statement is duplicated below as well. Perhaps remove it here?

messages.author: Satish
messages.text: This line seems unnecessary since you talk about the callback below

messages.author: Satish
messages.text: remove 'the actual'

messages.author: Satish
messages.text: We probably shouldn't talk about the UI here, just how to use the API?

messages.author: Satish
messages.text: remove 'during the start the call will fail and '

messages.author: Satish
messages.text: start -> "start"

messages.author: Satish
messages.text: 'anything else than the current extension' -> 'another extension or web page'

messages.author: Satish
messages.text: 'in use' -> 'active'

messages.author: Satish
messages.text: 'its result is limited to' -> 'it only checks for'

messages.author: Satish
messages.text: this paragraph seems unnecessary as these are obvious from the above descriptions

messages.author: Satish
messages.text: Simplify as 'Listen to the <code>onResult<code> event to receive speech recognition results.'. If you prefer to use 'chrome.experimental.speechInput.' prefix suggest doing the same throughout this doc.

messages.author: Satish
messages.text: could simplify as 'To handle errors during speech recognition listen for the onError event.' - and give a short code sample similar to above. The callback's parameter would be different I presume

messages.author: Satish
messages.text: could simplify as 'To stop speech recognition call the stop method. If provided, callback' ...

messages.author: Satish
messages.text: could simplify similar to suggested above for start

messages.author: Satish
messages.text:
Perhaps simplify this as just a listing of these two events. "
  • onSoundStart - Event generated when start of sound is detected (from previously being silent)
  • onSoundEnd - Event generated when end of sound is detected (a continued period of silence)
"
